intro: Oncostemum pendulum, commonly known as the hanging sandmat, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. Oncostemum pendulum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
